result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Daniel Hernandez

records.addlTxt: Defense's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond; received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Jose Daniel Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Copeland has been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez in court in person.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for Jose Daniel Hernandez.  Attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant's family contacted the Court regarding Defendant's in custody status. Clerk contacted Intake Coordinator.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
